abstract: VisaNet, the Brazilian affiliate of Visa, said it had banned 19 brokerages from taking part in its upcoming initial public offering, claiming they released unapproved advertising material on the sale.
snippet: VisaNet, the Brazilian affiliate of Visa, said it had banned 19 brokerages from taking part in its upcoming initial public offering, claiming they released unapproved advertising material on the sale.
lead_paragraph: Update | 12:15 p.m. VisaNet, the Brazilian affiliate of Visa, said it had banned 19 brokerage firms from taking part in its upcoming initial public offering, which could end up being the largest ever in Brazil if it prices at the high end of its expected range. VisaNet said the firms released unapproved advertising material on the sale, according to a statement on its Web site.

headline.main: VisaNet Bans 19 Underwriters from Stock Sale
